page.title: 10The Carnival Mickleton
page.content: The carnival was in the Senior Playing Field.My mother was on a float with the Mickleton Playgroup.There were four more floats by Threeways,the Cubs the Scouts,and the Brownies who won the competition with 'The Magic Round- about'.There were lots of stalls,my favourite was archery.It was 15 pence for three arrows.I had 6 arrows and hit the target twice.There was a bar inside the pavilion.There were cakes, drinks,ice lollies and ice creams. There were pony rides,and a man with a red-tailed hawk.He said that normally it would catch its own prey which are rabbits and voles.A stall that was very popular was a stall where you threw darts at little bags fixed on a board,some with money in.The most you could win was Â£1.I won two pence.There was bowling at nine skittles which you tried to knock down with three balls.
